self.title: Birth date collection using three date fields

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.2

parentScenario.title: Birth date collection using three date fields

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for scenario field Birth Date Collection.STUDYID

fields.definition: A unique identifier for a study.
fields.implementationNotes: Although this field is not typically captured on a CRF, it should be displayed clearly on the CRF and/or in the EDC system. This field can be included in the database or populated during SDTM-based dataset creation before submission.
fields.label: Study Identifier
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.
fields.name: STUDYID

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.2

parentScenario.title: Birth date collection using three date fields

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for scenario field Birth Date Collection.SITEID

fields.definition: A unique identifier for a site within a study.
fields.implementationNotes: Paper: This is typically pre-printed in the header of each CRF page for single-site studies. For studies with multiple sites, this field may be left blank so that the number can be recorded by the site, or it may be pre-printed on the CRFs that are shipped to each site. \n EDC: This should be pre-populated.
fields.label: Study Site Identifier
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.
fields.name: SITEID

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.2

parentScenario.title: Birth date collection using three date fields

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for scenario field Birth Date Collection.SUBJID

fields.completionInstructions: Record the identifier for the subject.
fields.definition: A unique subject identifier within a site and a study.
fields.implementationNotes: Paper: This is typically recorded in the header of each CRF page. EDC: The subject identifiers may be system-generated. This CDASH variable is typically collected in all CDASH domains. However, this CDASH variable is populated only in the SDTMIG DM domain. For more information, refer to the SDTMIG.
fields.label: Subject Identifier for the Study
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.
fields.name: SUBJID

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.2

parentScenario.title: Birth date collection using three date fields

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for scenario field Birth Date Collection.BRTHDD

fields.completionInstructions: Record the subject's day of birth (e.g., 01 or 31).
fields.definition: Day of birth of the subject, in an unambiguous date format (e.g., DD).
fields.implementationNotes: Day of Birth is the collected variable used for recording the day component of the Date of Birth. The sponsor may choose to database the date of birth as a single variable (BRTHDAT), or as separate variables for each component of the date/time (BRTHYY, BRTHMO, BRTHDD, BRTHTIM). The sponsor may choose a method based on database considerations, or for regulatory reasons. It is expected that what is collected for BRTHDAT (e.g., complete date, components) is reported in the SDTMIG variable BRTHDTC in the ISO 8601 format. If data are collected in a manner resulting in a reduced precision level, then AGE (SDTM expected variable), if not collected on the CRF, should be derived using a documented algorithm that describes how the age was derived and/or imputed for those birth dates collected with reduced precision.
fields.label: Birth Day
fields.mappingInstructions: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. For the SDTM submission dataset, concatenate all collected CDASH DATE and TIME components and populate the SDTMIG variable BRTHDTC in ISO 8601 format.
fields.name: BRTHDD
fields.questionText: What is the subject's day of birth?

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.2

parentScenario.title: Birth date collection using three date fields

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for scenario field Birth Date Collection.BRTHMO

fields.completionInstructions: Record the subject's month of birth [e.g., (in local language short month format) (JAN-DEC) or (ENE-DIE) or (JAN-DEZ), etc.].
fields.definition: Month of birth of the subject, in an unambiguous date format (e.g., MMM).
fields.implementationNotes: Month of Birth is the collected variable used for recording the month component of the Date of Birth. The sponsor may choose to database the date of birth as a single variable (BRTHDAT), or as separate variables for each component of the date/time (BRTHYY, BRTHMO, BRTHDD, BRTHTIM). The sponsor may choose a method based on database considerations, or for regulatory reasons. It is expected that what is collected for BRTHDAT (e.g., complete date, components) is reported in the SDTMIG variable BRTHDTC in the ISO 8601 format. If data are collected in a manner resulting in a reduced precision level, then AGE (SDTM expected variable), if not collected on the CRF, should be derived using a documented algorithm that describes how the age was derived and/or imputed for those birth dates collected with reduced precision.
fields.label: Birth Month
fields.mappingInstructions: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. For the SDTM submission dataset, concatenate all collected CDASH DATE and TIME components and populate the SDTMIG variable BRTHDTC in ISO 8601 format.
fields.name: BRTHMO
fields.questionText: What is the subject's month of birth?

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.2

parentScenario.title: Birth date collection using three date fields

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for scenario field Birth Date Collection.BRTHYY

fields.completionInstructions: Record the subject's year of birth (e.g., YYYY, a four-digit year).
fields.definition: The year of birth of the subject, in an unambiguous date format (e.g., YYYY).
fields.implementationNotes: Year of Birth is the collected variable used for recording the year component of the Date of Birth. The sponsor may choose to database the date of birth as a single variable (BRTHDAT), or as separate variables for each component of the date/time (BRTHYY, BRTHMO, BRTHDD, BRTHTIM). The sponsor may choose a method based on database considerations, or for regulatory reasons. It is expected that what is collected for BRTHDAT (e.g., complete date, components) is reported in the SDTMIG variable BRTHDTC in the ISO 8601 format. If data are collected in a manner resulting in a reduced precision level, then AGE (SDTM expected variable), if not collected on the CRF, should be derived using a documented algorithm that describes how the age was derived and/or imputed for those birth dates collected with reduced precision.
fields.label: Birth Year
fields.mappingInstructions: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. For the SDTM submission dataset, concatenate all collected CDASH DATE and TIME components and populate the SDTMIG variable BRTHDTC in ISO 8601 format.
fields.name: BRTHYY
fields.questionText: What is the subject's year of birth?

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.2

parentScenario.title: Birth date collection using three date fields

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for scenario field Birth Date Collection.BRTHTIM

fields.completionInstructions: Record the time of birth (as completely as possible).
fields.definition: The time of birth of the subject, in an unambiguous time format (e.g., hh:mm).
fields.implementationNotes: The level of detail collected by Time of Birth may be necessary for analysis for some pediatric, natal, or neonatal studies. The sponsor may choose to database the date of birth as a single variable (BRTHDAT), or as separate variables for each component of the date/time (BRTHYY, BRTHMO, BRTHDD, BRTHTIM). The sponsor may choose a method based on database considerations, or for regulatory reasons. It is expected that what is collected for BRTHDAT (e.g., complete date, components) is reported in the SDTMIG variable BRTHDTC in the ISO 8601 format. If data are collected in a manner resulting in a reduced precision level, then AGE (SDTMIG expected variable), if not collected on the CRF, should be derived using a documented algorithm that describes how the age was derived and/or imputed for those birth dates collected with reduced precision.
fields.label: Birth Time
fields.mappingInstructions: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. For the SDTM submission dataset, concatenate all collected CDASH DATE and TIME components and populate the SDTMIG variable BRTHDTC in ISO 8601 format.
fields.name: BRTHTIM
fields.questionText: What is the subject's time of birth?

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.2

parentScenario.title: Birth date collection using three date fields

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for scenario field Birth Date Collection.AGE

fields.definition: The age of the subject, expressed in AGEU.
fields.implementationNotes: If age is collected, it should be collected as a number and, to be correctly interpreted, the age value should be associated to a variable for the age unit. It may be necessary to know when the age was collected, as age may need to be recalculated for analysis, such as deriving age at a reference start time (RFSTDTC for SDTM). BRTHDTC may not be available in all cases (due to subject privacy concerns). If AGE is collected, then it is recommended that the date of collection also be recorded, either separately or by association to the date of the visit.
fields.label: Age
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.
fields.name: AGE

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C66781

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.2

parentScenario.title: Birth date collection using three date fields

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for scenario field Birth Date Collection.AGEU

fields.completionInstructions: Record the appropriate age unit (e.g., YEARS, MONTHS, WEEKS, etc.).
fields.definition: Units of time routinely used to express the age of a person.
fields.implementationNotes: If age is captured on the CRF, the age unit must be known to make the age value meaningful. The age unit might be collected on the CRF, in those cases where the protocol allows for any age group, or it may be pre-printed on the CRF (typically with the unit of "years").
fields.label: Age Units
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.
fields.name: AGEU
fields.questionText: What is the age unit used?

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.2

parentScenario.title: Birth date collection using three date fields

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for scenario field Birth Date Collection.DMDAT

fields.completionInstructions: Record the date of collection using this format (DD-MON-YYYY).
fields.definition: The date of collection, represented in an unambiguous date format (e.g., DD-MON-YYYY).
fields.implementationNotes: The date of collection may be determined from the date of visit; if so, a separate date field is not needed.
fields.label: Demographics Collection Date
fields.mappingInstructions: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. For the SDTM submission dataset, concatenate all collected CDASH DATE and TIME components and populate the SDTMIG variable DMDTC in ISO 8601 format.
fields.name: DMDAT
fields.questionText: What is the date of collection?

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C66731

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.2

parentScenario.title: Birth date collection using three date fields

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for scenario field Birth Date Collection.SEX

fields.completionInstructions: Record the appropriate sex (e.g., F (female), M (male).
fields.definition: Sex of the subject, as determined by the investigator.
fields.implementationNotes: Collect the subject's sex or gender, as reported by the investigator. This is a phenotypic assessment and not a genotypic assessment.
fields.label: Sex
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.
fields.name: SEX
fields.questionText: What is the sex of the subject?

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C66790

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.2

parentScenario.title: Birth date collection using three date fields

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for scenario field Birth Date Collection.ETHNIC

fields.completionInstructions: Study participants should self-report ethnicity, with ethnicity being asked about before race.
fields.definition: A social group characterized by a distinctive social and cultural tradition maintained from generation to generation, a common history and origin, and a sense of identification with the group; members of the group have distinctive features in their way of life, shared experiences and often a common genetic heritage; these features may be reflected in their experience of health and disease.
fields.implementationNotes: For use when values are being collected using the exact non-extensible ETHNIC codelist (C66790) values. Sponsors should refer to the FDA's Collection of Race and Ethnicity Data in Clinical Trials guidance regarding the collection of ethnicity (http://www.fda.gov/).
fields.label: Ethnicity
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.
fields.name: ETHNIC
fields.questionText: Do you consider yourself Hispanic/Latino or not Hispanic/Latino?

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C128690

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.2

parentScenario.title: Birth date collection using three date fields

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for scenario field Birth Date Collection.CETHNIC

fields.completionInstructions: Study participants should self-report ethnicity, with ethnicity being asked about before race.
fields.definition: A social group characterized by a distinctive social and cultural tradition maintained from generation to generation, a common history and origin, and a sense of identification with the group; members of the group have distinctive features in their way of life, shared experiences and often a common genetic heritage; these features may be reflected in their experience of health and disease.
fields.implementationNotes: Use when values are collected using the NCI Thesaurus codelist for Ethnicity As Collected (C128690), the extended HL7 hierarchy of codelist values, or other regulatory agency-specific controlled terminology for ethnic group. Sponsors may append a suffix to denote multiple collected ethnicities (e.g. CETHNIC1, CETHNIC2).
fields.label: Collected Ethnicity
fields.mappingInstructions: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. This information could be submitted in a SUPPDM dataset as the value of SUPPDM.QVAL where SUPPDM.QNAM = "CETHNIC" and SUPPDM.QLABEL= "Collected Ethnicity". See SDTMIG DM Domain. Refer to the current SDTM and SDTMIG for instructions on placement of non-standard variables in SDTM domains.
fields.name: CETHNIC
fields.questionText: What is the ethnicity of the subject?

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C74457

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.2

parentScenario.title: Birth date collection using three date fields

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for scenario field Birth Date Collection.RACE

fields.completionInstructions: Study participants should self-report race, with race being asked about after ethnicity.
fields.definition: An arbitrary classification based on physical characteristics; a group of persons related by common descent or heredity (US Center for Disease Control).
fields.implementationNotes: In the US, use RACE when collecting the 5 FDA designations for race (i.e., American Indian or Alaska Native, Asian, Black or African American, Native Hawaiian or Other Pacific Islander, White; see (http://www.fda.gov/). See also the SDTMIG DM domain. For studies where data are collected outside the US, the recommended categories are the same except for Black instead of Black or African American. If multiple races are collected, an alternate sponsor-defined variable structure would be required. Sponsors may record multiple self-reported races for a subject by appending a suffix to denote multiple collected races (e.g., RACE1, RACE2) and populate RACE with the value MULTIPLE.
fields.label: Race
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.
fields.name: RACE
fields.questionText: Which of the following five racial designations best describes you? (More than one choice is acceptable.)

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C128689

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.2

parentScenario.title: Birth date collection using three date fields

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for scenario field Birth Date Collection.CRACE

fields.completionInstructions: Study participants should self-report race, with race being asked about after ethnicity. (The FDA guidance suggests that individuals be permitted to designate a multiracial identity. Check all that apply at the time of collection).
fields.definition: An arbitrary classification based on physical characteristics; a group of persons related by common descent or heredity (US Centers for Disease Control).
fields.implementationNotes: Use CRACE when more detailed race categorizations are desired (e.g., more than the 5 FDA). The HL7 Reference Information Model Structural Vocabulary Tables are designed to collapse up to the SDTM variable RACE with CT (e.g., American Indian or Alaska Native Asian, Black or African American, Native Hawaiian or Other Pacific Islander, White). If sponsors choose to map the extended Race codelist values to RACE CT (e.g., Japanese to Asian), then this mapped variable would be reported using the SDTMIG variable RACE. Sponsors should refer to the FDA guidance (http://www.fda.gov/). For studies where data are collected outside the US, the recommended categories are the same except for Black instead of Black or African American. If multiple races are collected, an alternate sponsor-defined variable structure would be required. Sponsors may record multiple self-reported races for a subject by appending a suffix to denote multiple collected races (e.g. CRACE1, CRACE2) and populate CRACE with the value MULTIPLE.
fields.label: Collected Race
fields.mappingInstructions: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. This information could be submitted in a SUPPDM dataset as the value of SUPPDM.QVAL when SUPPDM.QNAM = "CRACE" and SUPPDM.QLABEL="Collected Race". See the SDTMIG DM domain.
fields.name: CRACE
fields.questionText: Which of the following racial designations best describes you? (More than 1 choice is acceptable.)

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.2

parentScenario.title: Birth date collection using three date fields

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for scenario field Birth Date Collection.RACEOTH

fields.completionInstructions: If none of the pre-printed values for RACE are applicable or if another, unprinted selection should be added to those pre-printed values, record the value in this free text field.
fields.definition: A free-text field to be used when none of the pre-printed values for RACE are applicable or if another, unprinted selection should be added to those pre-printed values.
fields.implementationNotes: When creating the DM form, it is suggested that the 5 standard race categories be included. Sponsors may choose to include another value ("Specify, Other") with a free-text field for extending the list of values. The RACEOTH variable contains the free text added by the site. The value(s) added in the optional variable might or might not collapse up into 1 of the 5 FDA categories. See SDTMIG DM domain examples for reporting this implementation.
fields.label: Race Other
fields.mappingInstructions: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. This information could be submitted in a SUPPDM dataset as the value of SUPPDM.QVAL where SUPPDM.QNAM = "RACEOTH" and SUPP.QLABEL="RACE OTHER". See SDTMIG DM Domain. Refer to the current SDTM and SDTMIG for instructions on placement of non-standard variables in SDTM domains.
fields.name: RACEOTH
